metadata.title: CVE-2018-17962 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Qemu has a Buffer Overflow in pcnet_receive in hw/net/pcnet.c because anincorrect integer data type is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.8').
